triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Path planning is fundamentally a motion planning problem that determines collision-free trajectories for robots.

triples.name: Mobile robot
triples.relevance: Mobile robots are one of the primary systems discussed in the survey for applying path planning algorithms.

triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are a key application domain for path planning algorithms covered in this survey.

triples.name: Self-driving car
triples.relevance: Autonomous vehicles represent a critical real-world application of path planning algorithms.

triples.name: Holonomic constraints
triples.relevance: The survey discusses holonomic systems as a fundamental constraint type affecting path planning algorithm selection.

triples.name: Nonholonomic system
triples.relevance: Nonholonomic constraints are essential considerations that differentiate path planning approaches for real-world robots.
